thread.title: Oman- MoT holds promotional events in Qatar, Kuwait to boost tourist numbers
thread.title_full: Oman- MoT holds promotional events in Qatar, Kuwait to boost tourist numbers | MENAFN.COM

author: Muscat Daily
title: Oman- MoT holds promotional events in Qatar, Kuwait to boost tourist numbers
text:
(MENAFN - Muscat Daily) To increase tourist numbers and strengthen the sultanate's position as a premier travel destination in the GCC the Ministry of Tourism (MoT) held promotional and interactive events in Qatar and Kuwait recently.  Muscat Daily In Doha the event was held at Crowne Plaza in the presence of Gamal Sadek director representative offices - GCC MoT. 
The event showcased a wide range of tourism activities. Salim al Mamari director general of tourism promotion MoT said 'The interactive event was held to effectively promote Oman as a leading tourist destination across the region. We know for sure that the GCC is an important market for us and we aim to strengthen our partnerships with our neighbouring countries through events that celebrate the authentic experience that Oman has to offer.
'We also plan to improve our business relations with Qatar's travel agencies in order to boost the number of Qatari visitors to Oman.' In the past few months Oman has witnessed an increase in the inflow of visitors from across the Gulf region as well as other countries.
According to the tourism indicators report issued by the National Centre for Statistics and Information (NCSI) the total number of inbound tourists  reached 991000 till the end of May. GCC topped the list with 313679 tourists followed by India (112616) Britain (68566) and Germany (59679).
